title: By selling 8 dozen pencils, a shopkeeper gains the selling price of 1 dozen pencils. What is the percentage gain? - Quora

response.answer_text: Answer is 14.3%. Let C & S denote respectively cost-price & sell-price of 1 dozen pencils. According to given data, Total gain in selling 8 dozen pencils = sell-price of 1 dozen pencils Hence, 8S - 8C = S or 7S = 8C or S/C = 8/7 …… (1) Therefore percentage gain in selling 8 dozen pencils = [(8S - 8C )/8C] * 100 = (S/C - 1) * 100 = (8/7 - 1)*100 [from (1)] = 100/7 = 14.3% (approximately)

Let's assume the selling price of 1dozen pencils is = Rs. X Selling price of 8 dozen pencils = Rs.8X Total profit =1X(as given in question) Cost price = selling price- profit Cost price = 8X-X= Rs. 7X Percentage profit = (1÷7)×100 Percentage profit=14.28% approximately
